title: ORDER BY
markdown_content:
## Sorting Results with ORDER BY

The `ORDER BY` clause sorts the result set by one or more columns.

### Syntax

```sql
SELECT column1, column2 FROM table_name
ORDER BY column1 ASC, column2 DESC;
```

- `ASC` (default): ascending order (A-Z, 0-9)
- `DESC`: descending order (Z-A, 9-0)

### Example

Sort customers by name alphabetically:

```sql
SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY name ASC;
```

Sort products by price from highest to lowest:

```sql
SELECT name, price FROM products ORDER BY price DESC;
```

challenges.instructions: Challenge 1: Write a query to get all products ordered by price from highest to lowest.
challenges.starter_query: SELECT * FROM products ORDER BY price DESC
challenges.validation_query: SELECT * FROM products ORDER BY price DESC
challenges.hint: Use ORDER BY price DESC to sort by price in descending order.
challenges.solution: SELECT * FROM products ORDER BY price DESC

challenges.instructions: Challenge 2: Write a query to get all customers ordered by name in ascending order.
challenges.starter_query: SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY name ASC
challenges.validation_query: SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY name ASC
challenges.hint: Use ORDER BY name ASC for alphabetical order.
challenges.solution: SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY name ASC

challenges.instructions: Challenge 3: Write a query to get all orders ordered by order_date from newest to oldest.
challenges.starter_query: SELECT * FROM orders ORDER BY order_date DESC
challenges.validation_query: SELECT * FROM orders ORDER BY order_date DESC
challenges.hint: Use ORDER BY order_date DESC to get newest first.
challenges.solution: SELECT * FROM orders ORDER BY order_date DESC
